website_summaries.verdict: Some home cooks will find it too large for everyday use, but this pot comes in handy for large family meals, soup kitchens, and bulk vegetable prep.
pros: Heavy gauge stainless steel w/encapsulated aluminum for better heat distribution
cons: Some users report damage upon delivery
Quality of steel may not be as high as advertised
We recommend testing before cooking on induction burner

customer_reviews.title: All around perfect pot
customer_reviews.text: I have been shopping for a big AFFORDABLE stock pot. I can food so I wanted a sizeable pot to make soups, stews, chili etc. This pot can really handle large quantities. Last weekend we cooked and later pressure canned 34 quarts of chili. This pot can really handle a big batch with no sticking or burning. I hate to buy a pot that I cannot lift, look at, and touch. I want to know what I am purchasing with first hand experience. Big pots, available in high end cooking supply stores are way too costly to even consider. This pot, at $145, is a real bargain.
customer_reviews.author: ClaudiaB

customer_reviews.title: really good pot
customer_reviews.text: we got another 5 cases of tomato’s and needed a larger pot to do spaghetti sauce before canning. we had picked up a 3 burner propane stove for it to fit. keep in mind this would not work well for a “normal” sized glass or electric top stove. we knew that going in and understood it would only be used on the big propane stove outside. it worked perfectly. the solid extra thick bottom was perfect for many hours of simmering. day to day use for us is not a big deal. we got this only for putting sauces together before putting them in a canner. full of sauce 1 inch from top gave us 37 quarts of sauce.
customer_reviews.author: A. Matthews

customer_reviews.title: GREAT STAINLESS POT
customer_reviews.text: I finally cooked a meat sauce in my huge pot. Worked like a charm. I have a non commercial gas stove. It does take a bit more time to get this pot up to heat but it cooks nicely. I think the triply bottom helps distribute the heat as it was described. I followed the directions by not using high heat once the pot was up to cooking temperature. Cleans nicely too. I do like how the pot is well made with the thick triply bottom and the sturdy handles. I have a 20 quart but I think I'm going to get a 30 quart too.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Sanders

customer_reviews.title: I needed this pot for a long time
customer_reviews.text: 8 gallons of yogurt are made monthly in this behemoth. I can sit in it. I put it on my stove and it covers all 4 burners and the bottom is super thick and heavy. Handles do not get hot. It cleans very easily. It will scratch the inside of an enamel surface such as a bathtub or enamel sink if you sit it inside and move it around. This brings 8 gallons of milk to 180 degrees in 20 minutes roughly, as I constantly stir. And there is about an inch of space left at the top of the pot.
customer_reviews.author: Vonnie M. Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Inside of kettle has a rough finish compared to the outside in the pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I give it 3 having not used it yet, but closely inspected. The finish on the inside of the pot is far rougher than the outside of the pot. I bought it for making jelly and tomato sauce. My concern is that it's going to catch food and burn on despite the nice thick bottom. If it's impossible to clean this will be lowered to a 1 star rating warning people to run.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: New Professional Commercial Grade 40 QT
customer_reviews.text: We purchased it to use for our annual Chili-dog fundraiser. This was the first year after heating up all the gallons of chili that we didn't have a pan so burned on the bottom that we didn't just considered throwing it away! The multi layer bottom worked excellent to allow it to heat up evenly which made for very easy clean-up!
customer_reviews.author: Stratto4

customer_reviews.title: Just WOW!
customer_reviews.text: This pot is amazing. I bought this specifically as a brew pot and couldn't be happier. The base is very thick stainless and distributes heat very well. This was easily used in a 7 gallon full boil, but it pretty much won't work on a stove top at all. You will definitely need a propane burner if you plan to brew with this. We've also used this for processing our garden tomatoes for canning and it worked really well for this too. Finally clean up is a breeze is you have the space in the sink. Overall a great pot, with thick enough sides that I will probably add a ball valve and thermometer to it one day.
customer_reviews.author: JRC

customer_reviews.title: This is a great pot. The bottom is very thick and prevents ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought tis pot for using during chili cokoffs and for making massive amounts of bbq sauce for competitions. This is a great pot. The bottom is very thick and prevents sticking and burning. I use it on a propane burner for both instances and it distributes the heat great. The lid fits perfectly. There was some comments about the handles being rivited on and a question of their sturdiness. So far no problems for me although I gont lift them when they are full. I will definitley be buying more of these in various sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Chocolate Squirrel

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the asking price
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well built pot. Heavy gauge sides, riveted and welded handles with a strong lid. The aluminum core bottom makes cooking down tomato sauce less prone to scorching. Well worth the money. I expect this pot will be a 'hand me down'.
customer_reviews.author: Pyra Gorgon

customer_reviews.title: great pot for reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a boiling water canner. it is heavy duty enough to use on an outdoor cooker without fear of warping or damage to the pot . It can hold up to 11 quarts at one time. it is non reactive so you can process your acidic liquids in it. And it cost only a bit more than the boiling water canner that I purchased a while back. And I don't have to worry about chipping the enamel and rust. also there is plenty of room to cover quart jars with enough water while processing which I did not find with the canner
customer_reviews.author: Jim R

customer_reviews.title: Great home brewing kettle
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this so I could start brewing with full boils versus 2.5 gallon extract boils and also so I could soon make the move to all grain brewing. This is a very high quality kettle. Very thick metal and well built. The only thing that threw me off a little bit is that the picture is a little misleading. The picture looks like the kettle is more tall than wide, but the actual kettle seems more wide than tall. If you have space problems on your stove or burner, please be sure to measure.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome brew kettle!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this massive SS pot to use when I home brew. It has turned out to be a fantastic purchase.. It is absolutely huge allowing me to do full boil brewing making my beers all that much better. It is solidly built without noticeable wear and tear despite frequent use. Great heat conductivity and retention, again a big plus when using to brew beer. Clean up is very easy with little effort needed. I can't really find a flaw in this pot and for the money it can not be beat.
customer_reviews.author: michael Kamens

customer_reviews.title: 40 quart stock pot
customer_reviews.text: this is one Big pot very very well made solid lid is just as well built will definetly be buying some more of them just smaller ones . My hot water bath canner can not handel the 1/2 Gallon ball jars and this was the ticket for my problem and cooking sweet corn . this pot will deffintely get used and will be around for long time .we do a lot of canning when garden starts to come ripe this will be big time saver.
customer_reviews.author: pat s sr

customer_reviews.title: HUGE
customer_reviews.text: BIGGEST FRAKKING POT IVE EVER OWNED. I never realized how large 10 gallons is, but you could easily fit anything in this pot. The base is MASSIVE, and easily fits over two burners. Depending on what you're using it for, I'd say just double check the size you really want. Storing it definitely takes up a ton of space in my closet.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Goodhart

customer_reviews.title: BBQ hash
customer_reviews.text: I now have 3 of theses. I use them for making hash for bbq dinners. I am very impressed with these. I do use a flame deflector so there is no chance on scorching the bottom. Overall VERY PLEASED
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Big Pot
customer_reviews.text: If you need a big pot, this is a great big pot, especially for the price. Haven't tried it on induction, but it's magnetic so it should do fine. It's big and a big footprint, but took it to the beach and it heated up 5 gallons of water remarkably quickly on a rental house smooth glass electric stovetop and handily accommodated 15 lbs of meat and an equal volume of potatoes, onions and corn, and in spite of it's size, cleaned up easily. Very sturdy. Should last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Winslow

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS OF POOR QUALITY
customer_reviews.text: Today, after using this NSF 40 at. pot I found it leaking all over my stove. It looks like the stainless steel was of poor quality and small holes appeared on the bottom. This pot is a only 3 years old and has been used possibly 5 times.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W. Rice

customer_reviews.title: Almost a five star product.
customer_reviews.text: This kettle is well made and heats efficiently and effectively cooks without scorching. I'm completely satisfied with it. I use it for brewing beer and I think it was a very good buy. The 3-ply clad bottom transfers heat well. It is an odd dimension for a kettle; it's more fat than tall. I knew this when I bought it, though, and still find it very useful. The ratio of height to width is the reason why I gave this kettle four stars instead of five.
customer_reviews.author: JohnMJam

customer_reviews.title: Beer me!
customer_reviews.text: Used for brewing 5 gallon batches of beer. Works great and at the time I couldn't find a better price locally.
customer_reviews.author: JTH on Amazon

customer_reviews.title: AWSOME COOKING PAN
customer_reviews.text: This is the big one. I haven't gotten to use it yet, because it isn't canning season here. But I love it! I can't wait to start the salsa cooking and smell all the aromas mixing together. I'm so pleased with the structure of this pan and lid. It fits perfectly on my stove although it will have to use the middle burner as it's so large. But I can remove the lid while cooking from under my stove fan and that's important to me. This is a truly awesome pan.
customer_reviews.author: sharon

customer_reviews.title: Nice pot
customer_reviews.text: I needed something bigger to cook mash in over a propane burner and this pot seemed to fit the bill. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is because it arrived with a small dent in the bottom which doesn't affect the use of the pot but then again when you buy something new it should arrive in perfect condition
customer_reviews.author: Joseph N.

customer_reviews.title: 40 Qt Stainless Steal pot
customer_reviews.text: Not to happy with this pot . Will probably use to store fat wood near my Hearthstone soapstone stove . Went to All Clad 16 Quart .
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Robert

customer_reviews.title: Full Boil for 5 Gallon Batch!
customer_reviews.text: This was marked down to $100 when I bought it. Best freakin' deal I've had in a while. Reinforced bottom and solid construction. The inside diameter is 15-3/4" which makes it a little wide if you plan on giving your boiled wort an ice bath. But an ice bath alone for 5+ gallons wouldn't work anyway. There's no volume marks on the kettle so here's a tip, from the inside bottom of the pot up to the bottom of the handle rivet is exactly 9" which equals 7.59 gallons. Happy Brewing!
customer_reviews.author: Helmo Alkou

customer_reviews.title: Need a commercial stove
customer_reviews.text: It’s a larger than expected, good quality but returned. To big for my purpose
customer_reviews.author: Cathleen Whiting

customer_reviews.title: What a Deal.
customer_reviews.text: I use this pot for homebrewing and WOW am I impressed with the quality of this pot and you cannot beat the price. The bottom is very thick and conducts heat very well. I get perfect rolling boils every time using my bayou classic burner. I drilled a hole in the side for a weldless ball valve. The walls are thick, too. Works perfectly for my purposes. If this is what you are shopping for you will not find a better deal than this.
customer_reviews.author: Drjonesrn

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed to make beef stock
customer_reviews.text: So I ordered half a cow and asked for the bones. Little did I know how BIG the bones were and how much broth it would make. We ordered this stock pot and it came in the 2 day delivery period. It was huge, worked as intended and held the bones and amount of stock I needed. Seems to be of great qaulity and we have used it more than we expected.
customer_reviews.author: Grace F.

customer_reviews.title: The Tank of Forevertime Large-scale Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one of these through a warehouse deal, so mine has a little ding in the bottom, and the lid fits a little bit tight as a result. BIG DEAL! This thing is built like a tank, clad well on the bottom for great heat distribution, and the handles can easily handle a full load. It's solid, it's heavy, I think I'll be cooking in this over the fire after the zombie apocalypse and handing it down to my great grandkids.
customer_reviews.author: Somebody Like You

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pot for your brew !!
customer_reviews.text: If your in search for a great brew pot this is perfect !! I'm a newbie and I stove top brew with this pot. It is more wide than tall and hovers over two burners perfectly. This pot could certainly withstand an outdoor propane burner. The bottom is thick, the handles are very strong and the lid is a tight fit, no flimsy bendy sidewalls on this baby. My pot doesn't have any polished areas as in the photo. I do 5.5 gallon batches, and at full boil there is plenty of space left up top for the bubblies and what not. Fist thing, don't skip the obvious- clean this thing good, with soap until a paper towel wipes clean.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot, Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pot for homebrewing beer, and I am very happy with this product. I was carrying it around with over 7 gallons of water in it (going from my kitchen to the burner outside my apartment) and it felt very sturdy with no warping or flexing. It came to a boil very quickly and was able to maintain the boil very well despite being outside in 50 degree weather with the wind blowing right on it. Would recommend this pot to any homebrewer looking to do full boils for 5 gal batches.
customer_reviews.author: John Troxel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the home brewer
customer_reviews.text: Using this for brewing beer. I have brewed three batches in it so far. Plenty of room for a 5.5 gal batch (6.75 gal boil vol). Needed an 8.75 gal boil for a wee heavy, and it was really pushing it. Don't think I'd go that full again without a 15 gal pot. Handles seem very strong. Overall design and craftsmanship appeared to be very well done. Have no worries carrying the full pot up and down 15 ft of stairs from the burner to the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: the1zman

customer_reviews.title: NSF Certified 40 QT Stainless Steel Stock Pot 3-PLY
customer_reviews.text: This pot is AWESOME! Especially for the price. It is the perfect size height wise for any stove with any hood, even a low one. I have had an aluminum tall 40 qt for nearly 15 years, and paid more for that back then and the lid was EXTRA. But this pot is a Dream. You can stir the contents without having to take it off the burner,the contruction is exquisite,beautifully heat conductive, and cleanup is a BREEZE, Unlike my previous pot which you could not leave anything in it overnight to cool else the thing would Pock and ruin it, BUT THIS POT ROCKS! I could not be HAPPIER!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for making red sauce in large batches
customer_reviews.text: This is akin to the commercial sauce pots I would use in our Italian family restaurant when I was growing up. I made 40 quarts of sauce with it in one batch. Heats evenly on a gas burner. Very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product used it to make tomato sauce. Well made pot. Worked well on my burner. It heated up evenly. This pot held 2 full bushels of tomatoes. Perfect size I needed.
customer_reviews.author: Bre

customer_reviews.title: Great budget kettle
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for brewing all-grain beer, 5-gal batches. The kettle is a quality kettle for the price and beats price and quality of similar kettles sold through some of the major homebrew suppliers. Obviously for this price this pot doesn't have a ball-valve, for about $60 (in my community) I can get one put on, and I need to. Shipping was super fast, and delivered sooner than Amazon said it would be.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy construction, well-made.
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a heavy-duty stock pot for home brewing, one that would easily handle 6 or 7 gallons. This kettle does the trick. Unlike the cheaper, tinny kettles out there, this one holds up to 50 lbs or more of liquid. Heavy-gauge stainless, flat laminated bottom for excellent heat transfer, and robust handles that are solidly riveted to the sides. When I pick it up full, it doesn't feel like it's going bend in my hands, like the budget kettles. This kettle should last for decades if you take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: YellowAndGreenBoardBuddy

customer_reviews.title: Great brew kettle!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality pot and much better pricing compared to my local home brew shop. I use this primarily for home brewing. I was able to drill 2 holes for the ball valve and thermometer. Overall, I'm happy with the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Great canning pot.
customer_reviews.text: Great canning pot!!! Heats very even and obviously it holds a lot. We had some very slight burning with a full batch of apple sauce, but it cleaned very easy. No dark burned area left on the pot like thinner cheaper pots.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth F.

customer_reviews.title: Good brew pot
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I went with stainless, particularly this one for the price. The bottom does not scorch, the cleanup is easy, and the construction is very good. It is shorter with a larger diameter than many I've seen but it's working our for the best. My immersion chiller diameter is based on a 5 gal bucket and it fits perfectly in this pot with ample room (a few inches) around the outside to promote really good heat transfer. I just installed a weldless 1/2" kettle valve and now the brew pot is nearly complete. Thinking about a brewmometer.
customer_reviews.author: TA

customer_reviews.title: Kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Product was as pictured, delivered as promised. Much bigger than expected. Very happy, now I don't burn my food.
customer_reviews.author: vivianc53

customer_reviews.title: Big pot
customer_reviews.text: Big deep pot that works awesome on glass top stoves
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Chappell

customer_reviews.title: Needs measurement lines
customer_reviews.text: Love this pot. I use it to brew beer and it just feels very solid. Loses one star for not having measuring marks along the inside edge. This would allow me to know when I've reached my target boil volume and when I've filled up enough strike water. The large handles let me rest my mash paddle easily on top of it.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Looks and feel great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pot to brew beer. I need to make 5 gallons and this unit gives me plenty of head space to prevent mix from boiling over. Interestingly enough the price was cheaper on this one compared to a 20 quart one. From the beginning you can see and feel the quality. I wanted one that had the handles riveted instead of spot welding. Even though it came packaged in a double box it had small ding on the bottom rim. not big enough to be a problem. Came with instruction will update review after my first batch.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Gomez

customer_reviews.title: Good quality pot!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality! It's a sturdy pot and I love making homemade chicken soup in it (I make a huge batch, then I freeze some of it for future use)
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Velez Erickson

customer_reviews.title: I previously bought the 20 Qt pot and loved it so well I bought to 40 Qt pot
customer_reviews.text: exceptional quality and durability. I previously bought the 20 Qt pot and loved it so well I bought to 40 Qt pot. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: tammie

customer_reviews.title: Great Beer brewing Pot!!
customer_reviews.text: This pot is very heavy duty, rigid handles, nice thick base, and the lid even fits great!! I have used this on multiple brews days so far and it shows zero signs of wear, no burn spots(inside or out), and its not warping at all(unlike my cheapo brew pot I use to use). I highly recommend this pot for anyone! Plus an amazing price for the quality!!
customer_reviews.author: Helg

customer_reviews.title: great stock pot
customer_reviews.text: This Stock pot looks good has a nice finish. I am really happy with it and got it for a great price. However it will be a while before I brew up my first batch of beer in it. As I still have other stuff to get yet. This pot seems fairly heavy as well. The handles were spot welded and riveted on. So I don't foresee an issue with them. This pot should last a long time. I read the many reviews on this and they were all good with the exceptioon of one or 2, And I made my decision based on all the reviews. I think I made a good choice with it.
customer_reviews.author: Gregg Henrikson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty Brew Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty stock pot for home brewing Have not had a chance to use it yet but is very well made handles that are solidly riveted to the sides. and was cheaper then the 32 qt of the same brand since it had free shipping. I had bought brewing kit with a 20 qt kettle could not make a 5 gal batch with out having to add water to the carboy at the end and would burn to the bottom. I would but again if for some reason I would need two. was fast shipping ordered 11/22/13 got it 11/25/ also ordered kettle valve from Brewer'sEdge came the same day already installed and no leeks
customer_reviews.author: Supertramp

customer_reviews.title: Professional Commercial Grade 40qt Stainless steel Pot
customer_reviews.text: This pot sure came handy to help us make tamales during the holiday season. We use to do the mesa by hand, but now with a 1/2in Drill motor and paint mixer we have the mesa done in now time. It also doew duty when we cook the tamales in the same pot.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: This is heavy duty and huge and will be wonderful to use
customer_reviews.text: This is heavy duty and huge and will be wonderful to use. I cook in bulk to freeze and frequently have two different batches going at the same time. Love this pot!
customer_reviews.author: Rob and Diana

customer_reviews.title: Top quality pot
customer_reviews.text: I picked up this pot as an upgrade to my homebrewing system. It is solidly constructed and I am totally pleased with it. This is one top-quality pot. In time, when I need a larger capacity, I would definitely order it from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Great pot but be aware that it is wider than it is tall.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pot and I plan to get another one for my home brewing setup. I'm getting into decoction brewing and have discovered that my current, smaller decoction pot gets hot too quickly; I've been using this pot as my mash tun and want to get another one as I've noticed that it will heat up more slowly and holds temperature well. The picture on the website is slightly misleading insofar as since the depth of the pot is 12" and the inside width of the pot is 15", the pot is actually wider than it is tall. It does however fit my adjustable Blichmann burner very well.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Lamade

customer_reviews.title: nice pan
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to make sauce for our daughter's wedding and it fulfilled everything we hoped. We did purchase a large paddle through Amazon which made stirring completely possible.
customer_reviews.author: Cinnamon Cookie

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot!
customer_reviews.text: The giftee says this is a superb pot. It heats evenly and if you're worried about the (admittedly controversial) problem with aluminum cookware, this is a great solution.
customer_reviews.author: ofm_5

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Way too big but the pot is still a great asset to my kitchen. It won't be used often, but it will come in handy.
customer_reviews.author: amazon lady

customer_reviews.title: but it's great product. it's for serious cooking
customer_reviews.text: it wont fit on regular stove. but it's great product. it's for serious cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Elektra King

customer_reviews.title: Very good quality
customer_reviews.text: Nice pot, very good quality, thick bottom. Great for cooking gumbo, soups, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie Trahan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My daughter cans and she and her husband loved the large size of this pot...very well made!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent brew kettle for homebrewing 5-gallon batches
customer_reviews.text: Great homebrew kettle for the money. This let's me boil enough water to end up with a full 5-gallon batch in the keg, with enough room to save me from boilovers.
customer_reviews.author: Mark E Wear

customer_reviews.title: Great Home brew kettle!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for home brewing and could not be happier with how fast I reach a boil in this kettle. Don't look further if your trying to get off the stove top. This is a top of the line kettle that easily goes for $120+ only found it cheaper on amazon plus had free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rausch

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good size so i can make a larger quantity than ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a big pot for making salsa. This is a very good size so i can make a larger quantity than i had been able to in the past.
customer_reviews.author: DragonLo

customer_reviews.title: Great for brewing
customer_reviews.text: I'm in business now. Got the full boil going and I'm ready to make mass amounts of beer. If you like beer, get this. You can thank me for it later. Party at your place!
customer_reviews.author: mark2203

customer_reviews.title: I love this pot
customer_reviews.text: I love this pot. It does take up 2 burners on the stove because it is so big around but that doesn't bother me a bit. I have had other pots that were taller but found them more difficult to stir and see inside.
customer_reviews.author: Rene doherty

customer_reviews.title: nice thick bottom
customer_reviews.text: Great value, one small polishing blemish but solid and economical. I would puchase again. I have seen much more expensive pots with thinner sides. this one has a nice thick base as well. Great for decoctions.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey N Moore

customer_reviews.title: Stock Pot
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I purchased this stock pot because of the quality, and the cost. This is something that we use frequently at home and we love it.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey51

customer_reviews.title: I have always known that a magnet will not stick ...
customer_reviews.text: I have always known that a magnet will not stick to stainless steel and when this pot came I put a magnet on it, it stuck to it which made me skeptical. The box was torn up badly but the pot seemed ok. I purchased this pot from MVTRADINGONLINE and when it came it was twice as big as I needed. This pot is huge! so it was my mistake. I sent it back and after paying $139.89 for it my refund was only $92.00.They explained that it is their policy to take the shipping and 20% for a restocking fee. Be careful to choose your size accurately.
customer_reviews.author: Bunnie

customer_reviews.title: A huge, sturdy pot
customer_reviews.text: We use this pot for brewing. While it's very basic, with no spout or temperature gauge, it gets the job done. The first one we received was dented (the box was unmarred, so make sure to check the pot itself when you receive it). The replacement pot was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: SuburbanApple

customer_reviews.title: Great Brew Pot
customer_reviews.text: I use these for brewing beer. The first one was so good, I bought another. I use 1 for the boil pot and the other as the HLT. No scorching, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: D.R. Hawn

customer_reviews.title: New Professional Commercial Grade 40 QT (Quart) Heavy Gauge Stainless Steel...
customer_reviews.text: New Professional Commercial Grade 40 QT (Quart) Heavy Gauge Stainless Steel...you can cook a lot of mash in the basement on a nuwave cooktop
customer_reviews.author: B-rad

customer_reviews.title: Well-made pan
customer_reviews.text: We bought this pan to use for maple sugaring. It's a top-quality pan that performed well for the intended task, and we look forward to using it again in future seasons.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: We have a wonderful dinner with my new POT
customer_reviews.text: My professional Commercial Pot it is wonderful, the food was with the perfect flavor and we enjoy our the new soup.
customer_reviews.author: ClaudiaElizabeth Yepes

customer_reviews.title: gumbo here we go
customer_reviews.text: loving this pot. got it to cook gumbo for new years day. this pot is solid.worth the money. a great investment
customer_reviews.author: momflow

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. I use this for brewing beer
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I use this for brewing beer. Holds 5+ gallons of wort with room for more.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm

customer_reviews.title: It is a good quality pot and it holds up to any job
customer_reviews.text: Wow - it's bigger than it looks. Washing is a chore. It is a good quality pot and it holds up to any job!
customer_reviews.author: PC Mom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This pot is very heavy and well built, I'm going to buy a 2nd one
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Stainless Steel Beer Brewing pot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pot for brewing beer. You can't find a professional commerical grade quality pot like this one for the price! Everywhere else wanted $30 to $50 more for a comparable heavy duty pot. Perfect for home beer brewing.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Segarra

customer_reviews.title: Heavyweight steel. We have a commercial stove, so ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavyweight steel. We have a commercial stove, so pots large enough to fit the burners are a plus.
customer_reviews.author: rock-like

customer_reviews.title: Brew Kettle
customer_reviews.text: Using as a brew kettle... high quality stainlessbike steel stock pot. Heats up fast and has riveted handles. Drilled hole for ball valve with no trouble.... no leaks.
customer_reviews.author: B. Grungeman

customer_reviews.title: Image is deceiving
customer_reviews.text: Good pot, but don't base your purchase off of the image. The pot is wider than it is tall.
customer_reviews.author: JWUC

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: Great pot, looking forward to boring some holes and adding a thermostat and drain. Works well on propane banjo burner
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pot
customer_reviews.text: Great pot, heavy duty bottom, bigger around than tall (which makes it easier to stir). I'm very pleased, especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pot , good quality , great price., I use it often ! ( Ten Galion off soup goes along way )
customer_reviews.author: M.T.F.

customer_reviews.title: 40 Qt
customer_reviews.text: Very large but it works very well. I would recommend it if you have the storage room when you are not using it.
customer_reviews.author: prospector99

customer_reviews.title: nice pot
customer_reviews.text: Great price for a professional quality product, heavy duty pot that meets the needs of canning, brewing and cheese making.
customer_reviews.author: NNorthBend

customer_reviews.title: Great Brewing pot
customer_reviews.text: This is a heavy duty beast. It is sold under many names brewing supply stores sell them as "Megapots". I found a much better deal here on Amazon. This thing is sturdy and has a thick base its perfect for brewing full boils of wort.
customer_reviews.author: Eam1117

customer_reviews.title: Great pot for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Ever feel like making 8 gallons of chili? This is the pot for you.
customer_reviews.author: Hob Coblin

customer_reviews.title: Very nice heavy gauge stainless pot
customer_reviews.text: This pot is just what I needed. We are now making great soup for all that are hungry at church.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: great stainless steel pot
customer_reviews.text: I really, like this pot also, I use it alot for canning or cooking for big groups. it holds up well
customer_reviews.author: D. hoffman

customer_reviews.title: 40 qt pot
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it. Makes three heads of cabbage rolls with 4 salami
customer_reviews.author: John Brkich

customer_reviews.title: Worst Buy
customer_reviews.text: It is not as advertised. It is not heavy gauge, nor tri-ply bottom. It is just a regular pot. I needed a pot urgently, otherwise I would have returned it not minding the shipping cost. I have stainless steel pots from UPDATE International & Webstaurant, that are the proper stainless steel pot. I used it once, and the pot is discolored. I regretted buying from Onesource.
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: 40 qt stock pot
customer_reviews.text: this is really nice. heavy bottom works great to spread heat. I heated apple cider to kill wild yeast before fermenting and it was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: rem

customer_reviews.title: Is a great pot
customer_reviews.text: Good stainless steel construction, sturdy well fitting lid, Strong and secure handles. All around a well made pot. The company was really nice to work with to. The first pot arrived damaged from transport and they were very fast to correct the problem.
customer_reviews.author: charles kaufman

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This thing is well built. Super solid construction. Great for home brewing.
customer_reviews.author: J. Ramey

customer_reviews.title: stock pot
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this so my husband could make larger batches of his homemade bbq sauce. It works wonderfully, he likes the heavy gauge stainles steel with 3 clad base so the sauce won't stick like it does in other pots! Great price and arrived quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Anita

customer_reviews.title: great quality. I like the shorter
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty pot, great quality. I like the shorter, wider profile of this pot. Easily fits over two burners on my stove top to get up to temp quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Great Pot
customer_reviews.text: I use this pot for brewing 5 gallon batches of all grain beer BIAB style. It is a heavy duty pot with a thick tri-clad bottom that I would imagine will hold up for the next ten or more years. The price is better than any "brew pot" and the quality is at least as good.
customer_reviews.author: Tony Stern

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great pot, but was a bit too big for what we need....
customer_reviews.author: P. Vo

customer_reviews.title: Will become my brew kettle of choice!
customer_reviews.text: Was purchased for the homebrewer. The kettle is heavyweight stainless as advertised. Triple layer bottom spreads heat quickly and evenly. Looking forward to good results!
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Built like a TANK
customer_reviews.text: Using this for home brewing and maybe at some point a big old pot of Chili, but its really a nice unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: If you need a good, heavy pot you won't be disappointed. No complaints other than the obvious, is very heavy when full. Not the pots fault.
customer_reviews.author: kurleyg

customer_reviews.title: happy customer
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with my purchase. Clad bottom proved to distribute heat very evenly, and the lid fit nice and snug. I bought two pots and both arrived in great shape. I expect both of my new pots to give me a lifetime of service.
customer_reviews.author: westernmartin

product_meta.title: New Professional Commercial Grade 40 QT (Quart) Heavy Gauge Stainless Steel Stock Pot, 3-Ply Clad Base, Induction Ready, with Lid Cover NSF Certified Item
product_meta.description: This NSF certified SuperSteelreg stock pot separates itself from the average commercial stainless steel pots. The pot is constructed of quality stainless steel with a heavy-duty 3-ply bottom consisting of two layers of stainless steel surrounding a 5 mm thick aluminum core. This results in extra strength, allows for superior heat distribution and is induction ready making THIS one of the most versatile lines of stainless steel pots available. Ideal for soups, pastas, stocks, bulk vegetables and seafood. Commercial grade with brushed exterior and interior. Items marked with the NSF logo means that the item and its manufacturing facility was tested and approved by the independent testing company called NSF - National Sanitation Foundation (www.nsf.org) to be safe for commercial use. Many professional restaurants adhere to using NSF listed cookware in their commercial kitchens. The NSF logo can be found on millions of consumer, commercial, and industrial products today. Products evaluated and certified by NSF International include bottled water, food equipment, home water treatment products, home appliances, plumbing and faucets, and even pool and spa components.
